text: 0.5 bottle. Pours clear dark copper color with high, mostly lasting white head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malts. Flavor is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, decent roasted notes. Finish is medium long, bready and roasted. Medium body, average carbonation.
Jako jo, poměrně dobré pivo, jeho vůně mně připomíná klasická belgická piva.
Aroma of malts and toast. Medium head disappearing to durable layer. Clear amber colour. Delicate malty sweetness together with some bread and caramel combined with noticeable bitterness.

Appearance: Deep red brown, clear. Some off-white head.
Aroma: Slight malt, dark fruits. Earthy.
Taste: Dark malt, lots of dark fruits, prunes, slight sweetness. Pretty good.
Bought: Trade with Cuso - thanks!, 500 ml
Info: 26/5-2017, BB: ??/??-????
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Draught @ Pivnice Husovka, Plzen. Aroma has berries and odd, sweet malt
flavour has butter and sweet malt. dry finish. Too much diacetyl here; still somewhat easy to drink.

Butelka 0,5l pite w domu. Kolor bursztynowy, klarowny, piana biała szybko opada. Aromat trawiasty z lekkimi owocami, niezbyt przyjemny. W smaku słodkie, trawiaste. Na podniebieniu niezbyt przyjemne, taki średniak.
Tap at Prague Beer Museum at Namesti Miru. Deep golden in the glass, nice head. Mild aroma. Starts mild, malty, a bit moldy. Light fruity-grasy aftertaste. Okay.
0.5l bottle. Clear amber color with medium white head. Aroma: caramel, sour fruits, grain. Taste: caramel, grain, malt. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Light bitterness. Average one.

Bottle split on the 17.30 Bingohame to Coventry express, thanks to RTV for this .rar style, 04/02/17.
Hazed amber orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is tangy dark fruits, spice, toffee, wooded tones, light spice.
Taste comprises toffee, earthy, brown bread, sugars, light fruit esters, faint spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Drinks fine enough for a Czech hote golde/brown if a touch sweet.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle share thanks to RichTV as a winner style. Drank in Twisted Barrel Ale. 
Poured murky red brown tiny white head (bottle been open an hour). 
Fruity malty aroma and taste, dried fruits and a bit more malty than I like. Unusual beer though all the same.

Bottle on 17.30 Birmingham to Euston. Big thanks to Richard De Villain ( Otl of year). Pours murky red brown with a thin white head. Really fruity aroma. Taste is dried fruits, apple, a bit of malt and grass. Smooth carbonation. Last style tick and not bad
Bottle thanks to RTV. Sweet spicy smell. Murky dark gold colour. Cinnamon apple pie taste.

0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, caramel notes. Hazy amber copper color, white head. Malty taste, caramel, light sweet, light to medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation and bitter-sweet finish, more bitter than sweet, with caramel notes. Good and easy drinking.
Keg at prague beer museum namesti miru. Pours clear amber, nose is caramel, toffee, lemon, taste is sweet, toffee, malty.

0,5l, helder koper met licht geel/witte kraag. aroma van mout, veel graan, caramel en lichte hop. smaken van bruine suiker, caramel, weeïge mout, lichte hop, zwak bitter, matig tot redelijk zoet, toffee, lichte gebrande mout/suiker, zwak tot matig.

50cl bottle from t Bierhuys, Woerden. Somewhat pale dark brown with a small slightly off-white head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Subtle sweet and bitter tones. Caramel, malts and nuts. Mediocre brew.
Bottle find at our local bottleshop. Poured clear Brown with a light off white head. Nose of sweet malts, caramel, slight toffee, citrus, cooked vegetable hops, taste of caramel, light fruits
Pours in deep amber coliur with medium size white head, clear liquid. Aroma of caramel, hay, cream-soda. Medium bitter, lightly sweet, no sourness. Light body, watery feel, short bitter aftertaste

Tap (Dvou Strasidel, Olomouc)
Red, frothy head. Sweet metallic red lager. Head tasted strongly of metallic hops. Finish is caramelly. Smooth palate, and OK carbonation. A bit dead and almost watery. Dull sweet macro mess.
Tap. Semidark brown colour with stable head off. Aroma of malts, caramel. Taste is sweet, caramelized sugar, light bitter finish.

150ml taster, draught at Prague Beer Museum. Mahogany coloured body, spotty lacing from a diminishing beige head. Smell of caramel sweetness, herbal dry. Mixed sweet taste of honeyed caramel and dark fruits. Drying, mid-sweet ending. Soft in the mouth. Quite alright, rather too sweet in the long run (01.07.2016).

Clear copper color with nice head. Aroma quite sweet (especially after youve been drinking Czech Pilsner fit a week!) with some bubblegum notes. Taste sweet, bubblegumy, with just a bit of hop character.

BOTTLE 50 CL. Clear copper, creamy beige head. Caramel malts in the aroma, along with grassy hops and some cooked vegetables. The taste is quite intense, if a bit sticky - moderate caramel malts, a hint of alcoholic spice and quite a strong grassy bitterness, which gets a bit too chlorophylic at times. A nice polotmavy.

#460Bottle 0.5l. Light amber body, medium white head. Aroma of caramel and malts. Taste is sweet followed by light bitterness. Caramel, malts, touch of hops. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Average commercial lager.
Bottle 0.5l. Clear, amber colored. AROMA- very low, apples, honey, caramel, bread crusts. FLAVOR- semi-sweet, lightly bitter, bread crusts with some caramel notes. Light to medium bodied.Not bad.
Pours orange with a creamy/foamy white head. Aroma is malty with some unusual hop. Med minus body. Malty, yet hoppy. Pretty tasty.

Aroma: caramel and yeast.
Taste: sweet with light spicy bitterness and light sourness.
Caramel and hoppy aftertaste.

Plain and drinkable.
Some odd yeasts in aroma.
Clear red color, big off-white head. Lots of caramel and some malt, sweet caramely taste, very drinkable. Thin body, soft carbonation. Nice lager. //Mercator Maribor
Pale brown colour with thin head. Aroma has a touch of herbs and malts. Flavour is similar with a light fruitiness in the finish.

Pours a clear coppery color, topped with a fine tan head, quite lasting. Malty aroma, a bit biscuity with mild grassy notes later on. Taste is sweet, malty and a gentle presence of caramel. Gentle bitterness. Nice and drinkable though nothing special.
25 cl. 5,2 % Rødlig øl af den suveræne slags. Virkelig elegant. Smagt på Prague Beer Museum Husova.

Caramelly Saaz aromas. Simple malt and caramel taste with good Saaz flavor and firm bitterness. 
Nice palate and dry hoppy finish that invites further drinking.
From bottle at Desert Klub, Brno, with TO, HDI, RA and OSG 04.10.15. Clear amber. Clear and persistent off-white head. Fruity, syrupy and sweet aroma

Beautiful amber lager with reasonable foam and easy lively carbonation. Good caramel aroma and lovely mellow malty taste where caramel malt really unfolds and comes into its element surrounded only by a suitably discreet hoppy bitterness. Very nice beer.
0.5l bottle. Amber color with disappearing head. Aroma is toffee and caramel. Taste is sweet with caramel notes. Overall its good beer with nice caramel character.

Enjoyed a draft pint of this beer by the Vltava on the outskirts of Prague. The beer had a dark cloudy amber-brown appearance with an off-white head that had great retention, lacing, and cling. The aroma was a blend of grainy, earthy, and straw hops along with a touch of malt. The taste had some malty caramel tones, but also bitter and grainy mixture. It was a somewhat dry but full beer with a large mouthfeel and average carbonation.

Bottle. Courtesy of Sarky. Cheers Martin. Hazy, copper colour. Lots of bits. Film of lively, white head. Aromas of toffee. Nuts. Marzipan. Some fruity hop. Taste is light sweet. Soft, fruity bitter. Moderate body. Finishes light, nutty sweet, with a soft, fruity bitter close. Nice one.
Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Toffee and toasted malts, light bread, and low bitterness. Not bad.
Bottle thanks to Blipp. Pours dark brown white head. Nose/taste of caramel and toasty bread - lighter medium body.
Bottle. Orange pour with white bubble.corn, sweet malt aromas. Flavors are mild, malty, lager and corn tones: mildly sweet.
Bottle. Clear brown colour with large creamy offwhite mostly lasting head. Malty aroma. Sweet spicy flavor.
A amber color beer, with richer malt character, and floral hop mixture, served from tap.
Beautiful brown color. Malty with some mild toffee note. Pretty undistinguished overall.
0,5l bottle. Clear amber color, small head. Smells caramel, roasted malt, hops hint. Taste roasted malt, coffee and spice hint, medium body, balanced, very nice hoppy finish. Like it.
Fľaa 0,5 l z Pivotéky v Nitre. Číra gatanovo nahnedlá farba, dobre driaca pena, krúkuje. Niia rezkosť, pekne vyváená plná chuť, horký záver. Chutné polotmavé pivo.
Bottle. Pours a dark golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak bready aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy weak bready finish.

Nazwa piwa dość osobliwa;) W sumie nie wiem, z czego się wzięła... Piwo o kolorze miedzianym, mocno gazowane, przez co piana na pół kufla. Opadła w nieładny sposób. W zapachu gwoździe, słód. W smaku również metaliczno - słodowe. Goryczki nie uświadczyłem. Wypite przy okazji porządków w piwnicy, więc przełknąłem...
Flets biertje met egale amberkleur en weinig schuim. Doordringen, mag snel vergeten worden.

Finally the rare polotmavý rate. 500ml bottle. Clear amber shade. Smells bready, caramelly, slightly toasted. Like youd expect of an amber lager. Taste is much the same, but has more hop bitterness than I expected. Hope to try this style fresh on tap someday.
Aromat słodowy, lekko karmelowy. Smak delikatny, lekko wiśniowe, karmelowe. Delikatna goryczka.
dark orange color, off white head, smell of light grain, caramel, light malty sweet smell, smells fresh. medium body, good carbonation & good mouthfeel, quite sweet, balanced but kinda boring.

Bottle. Reddish amber, small off-white head. Light body. Taste mainly bitter with some tartness in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear amber with small white head. Aroma of caramel, toast with some fruity notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. Light sweetness, rather low bitterness.

Aromat karmelowy, wiśniowy. Kolor jasnego bursztynu, piana po redukcji utrzymuje się dość długo. W smaku lekko karmelowe, lekko słodkie, dymne, słodowe, wysycone. Delikatna goryczka wyczuwalna na sam koniec, przyjemna. Bardzo przyjemne piwo.
Parasta ennen 23.10.2014. Simamaisen ruskeahko väri. Pehmeä, kuivahko. Plääh.

Aromat karmelowy, słodowy, przypalona skórka chleba, jakby alkoholowy. Kolor ciemny róż, jasny rubin, klarowne. Piana szybko się redukuje, nie zdobi szkła. Smak delikatny, goryczka średnio niska, wyczuwalne nuty drewniane, wiśniowe, lekko alkoholowe. Piwo dobrze wysycone, wodniste, goryczka delikatnie zalega. Ogólnie słaby aromat, słaby smak, trzeba się doszukiwać. Gdyby wzmocnić te nuty, byłoby super, a tak to jest poprawnie.
(bottle) with msbernac clear bright amber colour with a small tan head; aroma of stewed fruit, then a bit of roast, then honey; balanced flavour with a long, light sweet finish

Bottle
Aroma-honey, roasty, 
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, average carbonation, short finish
Overall-drinkable
Some malt and caramel in aroma, same in taste plus med-low bitter hoppy finish. Not much going on , little too sweet, but drinkable.

Piwo o klarownym bursztynowym kolorze , może nawet lekko czerwonym. Piana szybko opada , pozostawia jakiś szczątkowy lacing, aromat słodowy , lekko karmelowy, chmiele praktycznie nie wyczuwalne , mam wrażenie , że jest taki lekko bannowo-goździkowy aromat jak w weizenie. W smaku czuć mocne wysycenie, leciutko czuć ziołowe chmiele i raczej słabą goryczkę. Piwo nie powala niczym , nie wyczuwam wad , można dopić do końca , ale chyba nie sięgnąłbym po nie po raz drugi.
Zapach słodowy. Bursztynowe, ze średnią kremową szybko opadającą pianą. W smaku słodowe, lekko kwaśne. Mocno nasycone gazem. Praktycznie brak goryczy.
Bottle at work. Pours amber color, white head. Aroma of caramel, sweet, some orange. Taste is medium sweet, malty, orange, hints of hopps.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Rather pleasant orangey lagered beast. Nice fruit. Some warmth. I cant see why the controversy. There is no controversy. Surprise!

Bottle from a store in Prague. Pours orange with a creamy/foamy white head. Aroma is malty with some unusual hop. Med minus body. Malty, yet hoppy. Pretty tasty. Never had anything like this. Quite drinkable.

Élesztős, porcukros aromák kandikálnak ki a borostyán színű test alól, meglehetősen visszafogott, sejtelmes jelleggel érezhetünk csak illatokat. Bak színezetű kortyok következnek ezután, süteménytésztás, vajkaramellás karakter bontakozik ki, tulajdonképpen keserű utóíz nélküli végszóval int búcsút.

Aroma: caramel, roasted nuts, oak barrel, butter; Appearance: clear brown, small vanishing head; Taste: medium bitterness, medium sourness, slight sweetness; Palate: slick texture, medium body, soft carbonation, abrupt finish

A Bock-Eichbier hybrid, with a pleasant bouquet, not too heavy.
Könnyed, malátás, melaszos frissítő polotmavy, itthon a magyar sörök között hiánycikk

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - beautiful orange to ruby colour. Thin lacy head. 
Nose - burnt toffee. 
Taste - more burnt toffee and with biscuits this time. Maybe even with a sweet spice. Some nuts too. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a crunchy texture and a dry finish. 
Overall - first from this style for me. Quite enjoyable.

500ml bottle from Premium Czech Beers online shop. Whoop! Polotmavy, 76 styles done. Pours lovely red amber, thin white head. Aromas herbal toffee, slightly metallic note, but not unpleasant. Taste is nutty caramel, light spice. Nice lingering finish.
500ml bottle @ Midlands Tasting Aug 14, At Richies Hop Palace. Nice toffee apple nose, relatively thin taste in comparison. Some hop sweetness and a little malts, but fairly average.

Shared 500ml bottle at the 23rd Aug 2014 Midlands meeting. Pours a pleasant amber colour with a quickly dying head. Toffee Apple aroma and taste, loads of caramel in there too, so a sweet fruity beer. I liked it and thought it interesting. This wasnt as sickly sweet as I may have intimated above, there was a hint of hop dry and bitterness towards the end of each sip.

Bottle (plus a couple more donated from Simon of premiumczechbeers) for the midland tasting group. Dark copper beer with residual head. Aroma of light caramel and malts. Taste is toffee, orchard fruits and some sweetness. Lightly carbonated. Decent beer. Completes the full style quota on RB at the moment.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle midlands beer tasting group. Amber slight beige head. Aroma is toffee apples taste is same good malty backbone. Medium body. Decent stuff.
500ml bottle. Pours dark caramel with a small head. Aroma is caramel, apple and cardboard. Taste has caramel to start and apple and bread on the finish.
Bottle at Midlands Tasting Group; clear light copper pour with a thin frothy off white head, aroma has caramel and roast malt, taste has toffee apple, sweet malts.
Bottle 50cl. Clear amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malty with notes of grain and caramel.

dark golden to amber colour, moderate sized light beige-ish head; aroma of some caramel, grassy notes and hints of citrusses; taste of malty-caramel sweetness with some bitterness; easily drinkable polotmavy

Barwa bursztynowa, piana biała średnio pęcherzykowa szybko opada. W aromacie owoce, karmel i słód. W smaku da się wyczuć owoce i słody ale niestety pojawia się diacetyl który to przykrywa. Nie jest on mocny ale jednak przeszkadza. Lekko wysycone i troszkę goryczkowe.

Bottle 50cl. Clear deep amber color, one finger frothy off-white head, disappears quickly, some lacing; aroma sweet malts, caramel, grain, bread, brown sugar, dates; taste moderate sweet, light bitter, light roasted ; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; light bittersweet finish, bit thinnish alas.
Aroma of malt and caramel. Taste is very similar to aroma with some sweet notes. Generally nothing special.

Clear amber colour with fastly dimisnishing head. Light aroma of caramel, toasted malts an some earthy note. Medium sweet and low to medium bitterness with short herbal finish. High carbonation. Low to medium body. Average beer
Bottle. Clear amber color, small white head, quite sweet aroma and taste of caramel.
Bottle. Light sweet, toasted malty body balanced by a light to medium bitterness. The latter could be more refined but still it is a tasty beer.

Aroma: DMS, diacetyl, and malty.
Appearance: clear brown color, poor white head.
Taste: corn and diacetyl, a little bit sweet, dark malts.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, diacetyl finish.
Overall: Total disaster.

50cl Bottle from houseofbeers. Clear amber colour, white head. Aroma of grain, hint of metal, amber malts, caramel. Flavour is likewise, faint butter, light-bitter finish. Light-bodied. Boring, and not really good IMHO.

Off white head. Deep amber clear body. Figures and curtains inside mug.
Caramel malts, toffee, butter, sweet prune to the nose.
Grass, toffee fudge, grains, small bitter touches to the tongue.
Normal body, slightly sparkling, sweet on palate.
Finishes sweet with some bitter notes, quite caramellish on a dark side.
[50cl brown bottle abv5.2%, BB14.05.14]

Bottle @ benzai. Nice amber to copper colour with a small to medium sized white head. Smells boiled vegetables, unfresh, weird. Tastes sweet, some raisins, malts. Pretty standard. Thin body, nice carbo.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Dutchdrebus. Clear light amber color, average sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, some caramel, a bit sweet. Average body and carbonation. Quite nice.
Bottle. Bronze and clear with a small head. Malty and a bit on the dry side. Flavour starts of quite strong but soon fades. Pleasant but after a good start fails to deliver.

500ml bottle from premiumczechbeers.co.uk. Clear orange-brown amber colour, foamy off-white head and aroma of caramel with malty, bready & nutty notes. Taste is sweetish caramel, malty, light roasted, with nutty & dark fruit hints and light bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, bittersweet finish. Very drinkable.
Amber polotmavy with light brown head. MAlty aroma and taste. Lovely bitterness at the aftertaste.
Clear amber color , medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt with grassy notes. Bittersweet taste of caramel and hops. Medium body , medium carbonation. Decent beer.

Pours a clear darkish red with visible carbonation and medium head. Aroma is sweet with hints of caramel. Also hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, butterscotch, caramel and malty, but ends quickly and goes a bit bitterwith short hints of hops. No real aftertaste, which makes it quite drinkable. Still has a "cheap" feel to it, but definitely not a bad beer.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Clear amber colored brew with an nicely sweet bitter taste and with perfect hints of caramel. Very great Polotmavý, this will be mine personal standard.

Tap at the Prague Beer Museum 1. Poured a clear medium to dark amber with a thin white head and some broken lace. The aroma is sweet caramel malt. The flavour is medium bitter with a smooth malt woody caramel light hop palate and a short bitter finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Clear orange-amber/copper beer, finely carbonated to medium yellowish-cream head. Cookies, caramel, toffee, parsley, freshly toasted grains. Fine bitterness, and just-not-sweet. Toasted, cookie malts. Leafy, hints at noble hops. Very slightly burning MF, light body, lively carbonation. Intrinsically good beer, but to get excited about it, is just asking a bit too much.  Tx, Peter!!
Pours clear brown amber color with 3cm beige head. In aroma alot hoppyness. Taste is a bit malty with bitter finish. Light bodied. Quite nice special lager.
Bottle, 500 ml at Pivkan, Zagreb. Pours amber, small head. Sweet, caramel.

Pours in dark pale body with low head. Aroma is dark malt, has caramel. Taste is malty sweet with medium bitterness, short lasting bitterness. Body is full, carbonation is medium. Boring, but not bad.

9/XII/13 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 2/XI/13 (damn, I never noticed!) (2013-1131) Thanks to Marie for the bottle!
Clear dark orange beer, creamy yellow to light beige head, stable, little adhesive. Aroma: very sweet, sugary, grains, hay, bread, some caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, very malty, grains, caramel, bready, little bitter. Aftertaste: bitter, some citrus, malty, bit of honey, caramel, sweet, nice hoppy ending, some dark chocolate, mocha even.

Convincing appearance, pours slightly dark with a thin foam. Interesting aroma with hidden hops and touch of herbs. Tastes very good - a bit sweet, not bitter at all, but really fresh and beautiful. Brilliant beer.
On tap in Prague .. good solid amber ale ...somewhat sweet and creamy with medium body .. I would buy again
Not much head on pouring, but nice amber color and very clear. Aroma not much, but the taste is very good. Not sweet, but not bitter either. I could drink several of these.

Bottle: Grainy, toasty aroma with hop notes. Amber color, white head. Flavor is malty, light sweet, notes of nuts and toffee, grassy hop bitterness. Light roasted malt notes. Dry, light to medium bitter finish.
(bottle 26/07-2013) medium fading white head, clear orange color, light fresh malty aroma and taste, medium co2, full body. BB date 30.08.2013.

Láhev 500 ml. Aroma sladí lehce chlebové a trochu připomíná i cherry rajčátka. Pěna je bílá lehce přecházející do hněda, jemná a krémová, středně vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je měděná. Chuťově je pivo sladí, karamelové s náznaky banánu který finiuje slabí hořkostí, velmi dobře se pije je vyváené ale není v ádném aspektu příli výrazné.
0.5l bottle. Amber body, white head.Aroma of toast. Taste oof toast bread, caramel, floral and earthy hops.It goes down easily.Decent beer.

Light brown color with one finger off white head. Aroma of malts, caramel, nuts, earthy hops, toasty. Taste is light sweet, light bitter a bit sour as well, quite drinkable. Light body, thin to oily texture, average carbonation.
Draught. Orange colour with a white head. Caramel, hops, malt aroma. Flavour is sweet hops, caramel.
Bottle, 5.2%. Clear amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel and a little toasted. Flavour is malt, caramel, medium sweet, little toasted, little bitter and rich.
Bottle. Orange amber wiht huge white head. Aroma malts, hay and grass. Taste malty notes. A decent thist quencher.
Bottle. Aroma of matlt and fruit. clear redbrown color with small beige head.  Rther sweet malt flavour with some fruits, nuts and toffee.

Aroma and taste is that of bread, pepper and candy. Appearance is nothing to talk about, and the head is gone too soon. Palate-wise it is a very friendly beer, and its rather crisp and somewhat fresh for a Vienna. There are better choices out there though, especially from the Czech Republic.

Bottle. Pours clear amber to copper color with nice white head. Aroma is caramel, bread. Flavor is malt, caramel, hint of bananas, spices and alcohol.Earlier Rating: 5/28/2012 Total Score: 3.3Lovely clear amber color. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel. Taste is also a bit sweet, fruits, hints of hops, no sign of roast. Nice beer.
Aroma/Malty-light, Appearance Head/Initial-small, Head/Color - white, Body/Hue-medium, Initial Flavor- light Finish Flavor- light Palate/Body-light
UPDATED: FEB 28, 2014 Bottled , CZ , Malt,caramel,bread and grassy aroma , Clear amber color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with light bitter finish , Medium body , Pretty good.

21-DEC-2012, bottle @home, from Netto.
Mahogany with lasting low off-white head.
Aroma is bread and sickening sweet caramel.
Taste the same with a spicy edge that reminds me of chips with sour creme and onions. Sweet, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
Bleh...
Not much of a demon here.
End of the world day - but we will not die by demons, I know by now.

Bottle. Pours clear amber/tea with airy light tan head. Clear aroma of malt with a note of caramel and raisins. A little watery mouthfeel. Sweetish flavour of malt and caramel. OK but nothing really special.

Bottled 500ml. -forgot to rate it earlier. Drom various locations in Zagreb. Slight hazy amber coloured, medium sized off-white head, caramellish nose. Sweet malty, fruity and caramel with hint of metal and rather sweet finish. Earlier Rating: 12/21/2002 Total Score: 3.6Bottled(330ml). -good czechs pilsener
On tap at Restaurace v Melantrichu. Small white head, clear golden to amber colour. Aroma caramel, very light roasted. Taste quite watery, light earthy hoppy bitter, almost light caramel sweet.
Keg at Prague Beer Museum. Pours Amber with an off-white head. Sweet caramel malt aroma. Flavour has basically just that. Hops are very slight but do offer a dry finish.

Bottle bought at Pinklec, Marti?eva Street, Zagreb. I drank this before, but this time its for real. Color is nothing special, head is ok. Smells malty, average. Taste is grassy, then some sweetness. Corny aftertaste. Not very good.

Sampled at SBWF11
Deep amber. Creamy white head.
Grassy bitterness and dark toffee.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber with a tan head. Good lacing. Sweetish, fruity aroma. Green apple note as it warms. Sweetish, fruity flavour with a malty touch and a light plastic note. Warming brings out a light cereal note. Bitter, slightly tart finish with a lingering grassy note, and a light grainy note as it warms. Overall okay. 10.10.12.
Bottle. Dark amber color with medium white head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, hints of oranges. Taste, malt, oranges, caramel, hints of coffee. Light bitterness in finish. Drinkable.

Flaske hjemført av Petro: Nydelig rødgylden farge med litt skum (som ikke varer). Duft av brød/malt og karamell. Søtlig, fyldig smak med brød, karamell understreket av fruktige noter. Mykt karbonert og behagelig munnfylde. Drikker gjerne denne igjen.
Bottle. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malt, hop, apple. Flavour is malt, hop, caramel, fruit, apple.  Medium body. OK beer.
0,5l bottle. Clear golden color. Medium thick white head. Caramel, malty aroma. Caramel, mild hops, malty flavor. Smooth to drink.

Bottled. Pours clear and amber with a medium sized off-white head. Nose of bread and caramel. Sweet flavor with bread, nuts, fruit and caramel. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Ends up more dry and with spicy notes.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Copenhagen Beer Festival, May 2012. Amber with a small white head. Clean malty aroma with toffee notes. Sweet malty flavour with a fruity hintEarlier Rating: 7/25/2009 Total Score: 2.7Light amber with a small off-white head. Malty aroma with a hint of green apple. Sweet and malty flavour with a little butterscotch.

Draught at Czech festival Kungsträdgården.
Pours red amber with very little head.
Sweet malty taste of red berries. Balanced but mainly sweet.
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, mlaty, caramel and bready. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. 090712

10/12 0.5 l bottle on Pivkan fest, Zagreb. It poured clear reddish body with smaller head. Weaker, but nice caramel aroma. Caramel and toffee flavor with note of dark chocolate and some hops that balance it only a bit. Medium bodied. Pretty nice and pleasant, with maybe a bit too sweet finish. Fine enough and rather enjoyable.Earlier Rating: 11/9/2009 Total Score: 3.330/10 0.5 l bottle from bar Runa, Zagreb. It poured orange to reddish body with small head. Weak malty aroma, sweetish sugary. Caramel malt and herbal hop flavor, slightly sourish and sweetish. Fruitness like dry figs is also present. Fuller in body with long nicely sweet finish, where also some herbal bitterness is felt. Pretty nice vienna, took few more bottles to not get bored later that evening :)
sweet malty aroma,golden, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, watery,light bitter finish.
Coloured as copper, clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Sweet aroma, light bread and faint caramel. Sweet flavor. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.
golden, amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, caramel, cereal, leather, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, average carbonation,
amber, clear, white foam, caramel, toast, roasty, cereal, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,
0.5l bottle. Clear orange gold color. Taste is very good. Hoppy and spicy and very pleasant mix of maltyness. Good refreshing beer.
Bottle. Mostly clear amber color with a frothy head. Sugary aroma of berries, citrus and yeast. Flavors are cherry and malt. Some sweetness, sourness and bitterness.

Bottle. Pours clear deep golden with a medium off white head. The aroma is highly malty and bready with some fruity notes. The flavour is malty and sweet caramelish. Light hoppy notes. Sweet malty finish.

.5l bottle from Kuca Piva in Zagreb. Another nice one. Dark copper brown, minimal head. Sweet water, grassy herbs, dark lager malting on light body. Pleasing sip, a nice dry bite with enough sweetness to keep it interesting, but it isnt balanced for the nice sweet notes for the dry ones. It is all over the place, but with good intentions, not a bad style to be working through. Would to to acidic and dry in a larger pint.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is malty with notes of grain, wort, caramel. Taste is caramelish malty-sweetness with a grainy, light bitter and slight floral finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Unspetacular.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle at CBF 2012. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel. Taste is moderate sweet caramel, medium bodied, some light roasted notes as well, smooth and well balanced, good beer.
. Earlier Rating: 12/31/2010 Total Score: 3.6Bottle from Pivonka, Hradec Kralove. ABV 5,2% Polotmavy Special.Pours deep golden with a huge creamy off-white head. Nutty malt aroma. Taste is well balanced, good moderate sweet caramel with toffee notes, crisp & fresh grassy hops bitterness.Very good and easy going Vienna

on tap at remeslnicka beseda in pilsen. a bright shade of amber with a somewhat disinterested off-white head; metallic aroma suggesting soggy teabag with nettles; a solid caramel malt character with a light tinny bitterness; nowhere near as interesting as the old stronger version of demonEarlier Rating: 1/4/2003 Total Score: 4.2delicious. rich copper, small amount of roast malt doesn´t impede skullability. just the thing to drink when you are taking on a couple of table tennis professionals somewhere in the mountains

clear brown, smooth offwhite head.flowery and slightly fruity aroma. Flavor is flower, malty,bitter lagerish, quite okayEarlier Rating: 8/15/2011 Total Score: 2.7tap at cafe langebro. Clear amber, smooth small offwhite head. 3  caramel, butter, bitter caramel aroma. Flavor is  herbal bitterness, caramel, buttery caramel, bitternes reminds me of english bitter.

Pours a clear and dark copper beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel and some bread. The flavor follows the nose with additional notes of alcohol. The palate is sweetness. Overall an average beer.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee and light fruit. Flavour is caramel, toffee, grass and light fruit.

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep golden/amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain, wort, caramel, corn and green apples. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long sweet grainy, light bitter finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

500 ml bottle @ Geokkjer Lambic farm. Clear, dark golden body with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel and fruit. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, alcohol, apples and almost no bitterness. Medium body and some aftertaste in the same boring style as the main flavor. Too sweet and sticky with a lack of balance.

Bottle. Pours deep golden with an off-white head. Aroma of red apples, fruitinees, malt and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some floral notes and caramel. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A clear, dark golden beer topped by an off-white, small, head. Sugary maltyness in the aroma, with pale malts, some yellow apples and a touch of spent grains. Rather boring flavor with spent grains, apples, pale malts, bread notes and some hints of bitterness. Medium to thin on the palate. Well, certainly not a favorite of mine. 120430
Bottle. Thanks to Larsa! Nice sweet and crisp vienna. Flowery and with notes of marzipan. Refreshing!

Bottled.  Clear amber, rocky head. Aroma or Earl Grey Tea and sugar. Sweet and fruity, medium bodied with clean mouthfeel. Hay and tea like hops, some bitter orange. Mid bitter finish.Earlier Rating: 3/26/2002 Total Score: 4.2Orange coloured with beautiful rich head. Big oily saaz hop aroma. Medium body, bitter finish and great hop flavour throughout. An outstanding darkish pilsener.

Bottle. Pours clear amber, with a moderate white head and vigorous carbonation. Aroma is sweet malt, bit of yeast, hint of hops. Flavor is caramel malt, moderately sweet, with a hint of roast malt, offset nicely with some hops. Fairly thick/sticky mouthfeel for a lager, without being cloying. A nice Vienna.
Flaske: Ravfarvet klar øl med et kridhvidt skumhoved. Duften er meget sødlig malt, men smagen er selvom den store sødlighed overraskende drikbar. Ok øl, men en tand for ensidig på den sødlige side.
Bottle as a gift fom my mother. ABV 5.2 %. Beautiful caramel color, thick white foam. Roasted malts, medium biterness. Good drinkability.  Recommanded!

cooked vegetables, earthy, woody, rotten eggs, basement aromas, citrus, spruce, hay, bread, caramel, orange, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,
flot ravgylden i glasset, med en flot stående skumkrone...lækker smag duft af malten , let sødlig...ingen overraskelse på gane...super..

Fantastic beer, if incredibly hard to find. Had this gem fresh in Prague in a small underground bar. First noticed was the rich color- a beautiful copper, with a light head and sparkling clear liquid. A bright aroma, with caramel and cereal malts, floral and perhaps citrus hops, and a definite, but not overpowering alcohol taste. Medium body, light and soft on the palate, playing well off the sides of the tongue. Fantastically well balanced, both crisp and sweet, without being overly bitter or heavy. One of the single best Czech beers in my opinion, and I would drink it all night were it not for the significant alcohol content. 

That said- its been hard to tell if this is, in fact, the same beer as others have rated. The brewery advertized as a 13% beer, and this is the only Czech "Demon" I found. My experience was entirely different from many of those below, perhaps as it was on draught.
Pretty sweet in flavor with slight bitterness. Dark amber in color with a white head.
Clear amber with a small white head. Caramel and grassy/herbal hop aroma. Quite alchoholic flavor compared to the low abv, very herbal bitter with just a light malt sweetness.
Bottle, nice brown golden head that lingers on the glass, lovely taste of caramel and some  licorice,

bottle from a 7bottle multipack chutí from Billa Suice. Clear brownish golden colour, large off-white head. Aroma of caramel. Medium-bodied, nice malty base with a lot of caramel and roaset flavours. Well-balanced, smooth, really nice.Earlier Rating: 5/28/2007 Total Score: 3.5on tap in Prague. deep yellow colour, nearly red. Low carbonation, very malty with flavours of honey.
Clear golden of color with an off white head. An aroma of malt, sweets, caramel and weak butter. A flavor of malt, caramel, hops and weak fruity.

Bottle. Alias: Pivovar Vysoky Chlumec - Démon Special: "Démon special er brygget efter gamle tjekkiske klosteropskrifter, hvis tradition kan dateres tilbage til 1420. Sand nydelse i hver en mundfuld. Ravfarvet øl med et flot og lyst skum."

Okay aroma with a sweet odour followed by a metallicness. Golden, clear beer with a little thick head. Disappearing fast, though. Taste is equally metallic and the sweet caramel from the aroma is hard to discover. Flat and boring in the end, but not the worst. Medium beer.

Bottle at home.
Clear dark orange with a beige head. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted). Flavor medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body. Very drinkable.
Fine head, redgolden. Nose is light with some caramel,  Soft with medium body and some length. taste is light sweet with a æittle apricot and caramel.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2012 Barva: zářivě jantarová s nádechem do červena, pivo čiré
Pěna: hustá a krémová s velkými bublinami
Vůně: po praeném sladu a karamelu, banánové tóny  velmi příjemné a lahodné
Chuť, říz:  karamelový nádech,se petkou kávy s výrazným chmelovým zakončením.  Pivo opravdu vybízí k dalímu napití. Je harmonicky sladěné  nic nevyčnívá ani neruí. Říz piva je příjemný  spíe vyí. velmi sluné pivo.
15 cl testöl på Prague Beer Museum. Jag undrar om det inte var något fel på den här ölen jag fick, för den var synnerligen smak- och doftlös. Trist helt enkelt, påminde mycket om en lager.
Bought in Prague in May 2007: Clear dark amber color with fine sized beige head. Malty aroma. Good sweet and fruity taste.

Clear dark amber with a nice beige head. Caramel + malt nose. Flavor is sweetish fruity but also bitter. Good carbon, light body. Malt on palate. Bitter finish. Great, thanks to a confusion between other people and the brewer seemingly changing the recipe silently at some random point. I just know Ill love doing the research for this... Bottle at the Pivkan festival. Dark amber body, clear, slightly off white head. Light creamy malty nose with herbal overtones. Light caramelly taste, weak, ashy, but not as weak as the hopiness, missing almost all of the bitterness and imparting a very vague herbal-metallic flavour. Not bad, not exciting.Earlier Rating: 9/21/2009 Total Score: 3.2Bought at the Beershop tent at the Rujanfest in Zagreb. Poured an amber/red body with an thick small off white head that went away at a medium pace. A fine sweet malty nose, caramelly, weak notes of cocoa. Malty, grainy taste, some very lightly bitter hopiness, a bit rustic, which shows some lemony notes. The aftertaste is hoppy too but again not all that bitter. In two minds about this, definitely not bad, but something about it just doesnt sit all that well with me. Still, cant say its not a quality beer.

draft. copper clear. light and mild pungent yeast nose. chewy, sticky burnt caramel, maple and toffee flavor.  rich, toasty and delicious with a full body and frothy carbonation. moderately strong sweetness is balanced by body, carbonation and light bitterness, with a zingy lingering finish.

0,5l bottle from Prague. Beautiful apperance. Clear deep reddish amber color with beige colored medium head. Caramel aroma, a bit like pilsners, but sweeter. Light bitter taste. Light body with creamy-slick texture and lively carbonation. Bitter-sweet finish. Its a very beautiful and delicious lager.
nose is fresh sweet malt, weak piss, medium bittersweet hops, caramel notes, weak hazel, feel is watery, carb is medium, taste is dry lemon, weak umami, some broad malt, decent hops finish

Bottle from Pivovarsky Klub, Prague.  Pours a pale orange with good carbonation and a thin white head.  Sweet aroma of molasses and caramel.  Flavor is dry and bitter though with a bit of sweetness.  Notes of molasses and honey.  Slightly creamy with a moderate hop finish.

Sampled @ SBWF on September 29. Pours golden with a thin white head. Smell is pretty stale with a floral quality to it. Taste is sweet and malty with caramel. Tastes a bit stale too. Not my kind of beer...
Sampled at SB & WF 2011. Pours amber with a big white head. Smells hony and sour. Tastes sweet malty with a similar finish. Abit weak.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is dark amber. Aroma and taste are rich buttery caramel, hops and malt.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 SBWF 2011. Golden beer with an offwhite head. Malty aroma, with some glue and some soap. Malty flavor, some vegetables, some hops.
Sample @ SBWF 2011. Pours clear dark amber nice beige head leaving lace. Aroma is soapy malty hoppy. Flavor is sweetish fruity malty bitter. Finishes bitter malty.
Bottle.Amber colour with medium white head.Aroma of toffee caramel,tosted bread and hops,nice well balanced and soft mouthfeels smooth with light body.
Botella. Amber clear colour, medium off white like ehad. Aroma is bit sweet like with toastish malt and caramel. Ok mouthfeel. Sweet caramel malty grain butterish flavour. Mild bitterness.

(Draught at Zly Casy, Prague, 28 July 2011) Dark amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, toasty nose with notes of caramel and orange peel. Malty, toasty taste with orange peel, bread, toast and a mild, spicy bitterness in the finish. Slightly bitter-sweet. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Quite nice.

(50cl bottle from SuperBest) Pours a clear amber with little, white head. Aroma of malt and bread. Medium-bodied with soft carbonation, watery texture and a short, bitter finish. The taste is lightly bitter with some sweetness. Okay but not particularly interesting. Girlfriend says: "Its like drinking müesli."

0,5 l. bottle. Clear amber colour with a small white head. From the aroma I get caramel, bread, and roasted. Light sweet taste with a toasted finish with some nutty notes.  Lively carbonation with a thin texture. Thin to medium body. A bit better than the  macro viennas - better body and finish.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, caramel, malt and bread.

Draught at Plan B. Clear golden/amber - offwhite head. 
Caramel. Toasten. Sweetness. Grainy. Grassy. Berries. Fusel. Light toasted notes.

Bottle @ Oasen Camping, Praque. Pours golden with a small white head. Very light aroma of caramelly malt and light hops. Sweet taste of caramel, light grassy hops. Medium body, low caronation. Sweet boring beer. 290711

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Almost no caramellic notes. Short light bitter finish. Watery palate. Boring.
Clear coppery red with creamy white head. Caramel aroma with a touch of hops, malty sweet and toasty flavour. Slightly alcoholic and hoppy finish.
Decent "half-dark". It is somewhat caramally but overall light and easy to drink.
Bottle.  Lightly fruity toffee malt and grass aroma.  Dark amber color with nice head.  Sweet light toffee malt and lightly bitter herbal hops.  Mild astringent finish.  Not bad.
Draught at Prague Beer Museum. This one is 12degree. Amber colour with a thin white head. Malt and spice in the aroma. Flavour is burnt caramel with some bitter hop. Finish is a bit metallic.

Köszi Düsi!
Világosabb vörösréz ötvözethez hasonló a színe, kristályosan tiszta és áttetsző. Habja vékony, sárgásfehér és gyorsan egy keskeny csipkévé olvad. Illata édeskés, karamellás, pörkölt malátás és picit füstös. Édeskésen, égetett cukrosan és igen malátásan kezdődik, ami lassan átmegy egy kissé fűszeres, borsos és gyümölcsös a végén pedig komlós és dohány szerű. Könnyű teste van és apró buborékokkal teli, amik enyhén csipkedik a nyelvünket. Utóíze keserédes, a legvégén száraz, hosszan tartó. Kellemes félbarna söröcske, ami könnyen csúszik, nem is túl édes, de nem is túl érdekes.

Tükrösen rezes barna színű főzet, közepes fehér habbal a tetején, amely vékony fátyolként marad meg.
Illata édes-savanykás, karamellás.
Kortyolgatása közepes csípősséggel indul, testessége sima, amely kellemesen betölti a szájat.
Édes, enyhén élesztős aromáját a karamell maláta uralja, enyhe pirítós és füves aláfestéssel.
A lágy, édes-kesernyés és közepesen száraz befejezését fűszeres és pirítós zamatok kísérik, amely egy édeskés-pirítós utóízben marad meg.
Kellemes, megfelelően kiegyensúlyozott, lágyabb fajta félbarna, melyet a Pivo Sörözőben volt szerencsém megkóstolni

Rating #492, on tap @ Kroegers House  

Appearance didnt promise anything special with its reddish brown colour and small head. However, the aroma was quite delicate with caramel, spicy hops and some malts, but the best quality with this beer was definately the taste. A certain woody taste was obvious right from the start and throughout the beer, accompanied with caramel, spicy hops and a bit alcohol to underline the beers entire character. Finish was fine and pretty bitter with a hint of alcohol. Delicious! Soft and easily creamy palate. This was a very delicious beer and probably the best vienna so far!

Világosbarnás, kissé rezes színű, habja pedig fehér, ám nem annyira kitartó. Illata malátás és karamellás. Akárcsak bécsi sörök legtöbbjében, ebben is a karamelles, karamellmalátás íz van a középpontban, de nagyon tetszett, hogy ebben azért nem vitték túlzásba, komló is került bele rendesen. Könnyen iható, vizes, és nem fintorodik az ember a sok cukros, karamellás ízhatástól (legalábbis nekem ez a fő bajom a bécsi fajtával).
Amberish colour with small head. Light bitterness in aroma and taste. Average carbonation. No remarkable after-taste.
Stredne horka polotmava 13ka.  Jedna flaska je tak akorat. Koupeno v pivonce.

Tap at Pivo Söröző , Budapest, Hegedűs Gyula utca.
Poured clear amber, some reddish coppery tones, small lacing tan head. Moderated aroma with caramel, some honey and herbal hops. Medium bodied beer with malt and caramel firstly, light hops and sourish yeast. Easy drinkable, nothing special.
Clear golden pour. Off-white head. Aroma is sirup and bread with a slight metallic touch. Taste is sweet and malty with some fruitiness and bitter hops.
Clear golden with a medium off white head. Sweet and malty aroma with caramel and mild grassy hops. Sweet flavour with malt, caramel and hints of grassy hops. Finished dry.
Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a clear amber with an off-white head. Sweet malty nose. Medium body, very sweet malts - almost cloyingly sweet - with basically no hops. 090410

Bottle 500ml.Clear medium amber orange color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, hay, malt extract, sweet malt. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, cane sugar sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20100313]
bottle. suprise. dark brown color, caramel taste but not very sweet. nice finish.

0.5 L bottle from Pivovarsky Klub, Praha.  A high, dense, yellow shaded blond head, over a slightly hazed, golden brown colored body. Nutty and caramelly malt aroma. Notes of dark bread and grassy hops. Good malt body with a refined sweetness. Nuts and caramel again, with a fresh sour tone. Mild, rounded hop bitterness. Medium body strenght. Caramelly malts and grassy hops in the ending. An elegant and easy drinkable Vienna.

Bottle at På Besök, Malmö.
Clear orange coloured with a small white head.
Sweet aroma of malts, hay, caramel and bread.
Fruity and malty flavour of hay, caramel and hops.
Hoppy finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a huge white head. Aroma is cornish and light metallic. Slight roasted too. Bitter and slight cornish flavoured into a dry finish. Slight spiced. Bitter and caramelish flavoured finish.

Bottled. An amber beer with an orangey head. The aroma has notes of caramel, malt, minerals, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, minerals, and a bit of caramels, leading to a lightly bitter finish. The mouthfeel is soft.

Bottle from Prague.
Sweet malt, cereals, Someh hops, but very subdued. Caramel.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2015 (draught 0,4l) (14.10.2009)
Light caramel aroma. Dark brown color. Large brown head. Light bitter, light sweet, well balanced. Caramel taste. Ligth bitter finish.
(6 . 4 . 7 . 3 . 14 = 3.4)

(Bottle 0,5l) (29.4.2011)
Sweet, herbs, floral, hay, light caramel aroma. Clear beautifully amber color. Medium white head. Light sweet, medium bitter, herbs, caramel flavour. Light fizzy. Light bitter, astringent finish. Interesting unusual beer.
(7 . 4 . 7 . 3 . 14 = 3.5)

(Bottle 0,5l) (8.12.2015)
Aroma: Sweet, light caramel.
Appearance: Clear, dark golden color. Long lasting, off-white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light malty, light caramel.
Palate: Medium body. Light sticky texture. Dry finish.
Overall: Good polotmavé. (6.4.6.4..14=3.4)
caramel, herbs, red, brown, clear, rocky head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, very good beer
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. High fluffy and lasting white head. Clear amber body. Mild barly malt aroma with a bit of caramel. Sweet creamy malt flavor with little hops bitterness, high carbonation and a long dry aftertaste.

The smell isnt too pervasive, mostly a standard malt smell. The red stands out quite a bit in this lager, the colours mix to almost make it look brown. The malt flavour is very, very smooth and tempered every so slightly at the end with the hops. Persoanlly I prefer more hops but I really cant fault the flavour for it this time. Its smooth tasteing all the way down and doesnt leave any aftertaste. Nice and clean. Too bad this one was from the discounted flat that never sold and isnt to be ordered again. :(

Pours deep copper good hed retention. Aroma is sweet and malty and floral. I taste some vienna malt. Very fruity. Bannana on the back palate.Very smooth and fresh. Bitter hoppy finish. Not the typical czech beer but I like it.

This poured a nice, dark copper colour which was somewhat cloudy.  The head was rather slight, and vanished quickly.  The aroma was slightly hopped with a lesser amount of malt evident.  Taste was a touch of malt and more so hopped.  A decent Bohemian but nowhere near the top of my list.

Light brown colored sith huge yellow head. Caramelly and hopped, slightly buttery aroma. Medium bodied. Flavor is much more sweeter with sweet caramel and butter in start, aftertaste is even sugary with thin hops and some weird cookie spices.

The beer is crystal clear honey brown with a half inch tan head. A pungent smell of skunk and yeast rise up from my glass and fill my nose, not a very good start for this beer. Roasted malts and a tomato juice taste are what I taste most, theres a bitter flavor and for some reason I can taste cigarette smoke on my lips after every sip. This beer is way to thin and is overly carbonated, I belch after every couple of sips. Not a horrible beer but way bellow average in my opinion (BELCH!!!!).

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 First ratingDraught at the Prague Beer fest, on May 22, 2009Clear copper color, off-white head. Sweet caramel scent. Malty sweet and apple taste, grainy aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/6/3/13=3.3RerateDraught at Prague Beer Museum on June 5, 2011As "Vysoky Chlumec Demon 12"Clear copper color, off-white head. Sweet, butterscotch scent, also sugary. Sweet, fruity, butterscotch taste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.6/4/7/4/13=3.4

Pours a light yellow/orange with a small head. Aroma is fruity, biscuty, and has a little spice. Tastes very fruity, banana, papaya, green apple, biscuity malt, caramel, nuts, and a hint of spice. This beer is one of the cheapest at andrew hilton and its not that bad.
Pours amber with smallish white head. Malt and biscuit aroma. Flavour is malt, bread and a slight toffee hint. Medium bodied.

Bottle, 5.2%. 11 months past BB date. OK bready and vinous aroma. Clear amber colour, small white head. The flavour is malty, vinous and bready. A little cream in the aftertaste. Ages better than their pale lager.

Bottle, bought @ Gallerie Piva, Prague.
Pours amber with a big, staying, creamy, off-white head. A hell u’ a lot of bubbles reaching for it. Aroma has hay, butterscotch, some grass. Medium carbonation, fine, dry mouthfeel. Flavour is a bit of butterscotch, sweet malts and light hoppiness. Fair vienna - quite drinkable.
50cl bottle. Pours amber with a off white creamy head. Sweet aroma of buiscuit. Quite malty with notes of diacetyl. OK!
Bottle at Craig’s house. resin, hay, amber, clear, aminimal head, light sweetness, light body, creamy,

Bottle at home ... from Pivovarsky club ... Golden orange big foam head ... unplesent lagery hop nose ... sweet malty fruity ... definityl better then it smellls ... bit metalic ... bit vegetable in linger not my thing at all..

Bouteille 500ml, courtoisie de Jean-Marc. De couleur cuivrée et claire. Nez de malt pâle, léger de miel, de légumes bouilliset de houblon herbeux (herbe mouillée et foin) ainsi que des notes de biscuits au caramel butterscotch. Mince-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture aux petites notes aqueuses et (texture huileuse à peine perceptible). Goût de légumes boullis sucrés accompagné dun goût de grains de malt pâle lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun léger goût de biscuits au miel avec des notes de caramel buttersotch puis en finale lon retrouve un léger goût amer de houblon herbeux (gazon mouillé, léger de foin) avec de faibles traces épicées (traces de poivre). Post-goût court, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux.
Bottle: Clear yellow/red colour,nice head. Aroma of lots of malts,toffee,some hopyness, and vegetable. Flavor is almost the same, thin watery mouth feeling, short finish.
Copper-colored aromatic brew with some heavenly qualities about it...drinkable, dry, hoppy, and clean.

500ml Bottle 5.2% a/v

Pours ruby/coppery in colour with a nice tan head. The nose is of malts, some spice and honey. Taste is spicy and sweet with a strange metallic aftertaste.  Very unusual beer, but then ive never been a fan of this style.

500ml brown bottle. Label states abv is 5.2%. Copper coloured beer with a small tight off white cap. Strong malt nose with caramel. Flavour is malty, somewhat sweet with caramel. Notes of straw and grass. Slight bitter finish with light toasty malt aftertaste. Medium body with fairly active carbonation.

Pours a bronzy redish colour with strong off white head which disapates quickly. Sweetish nose, some slight fragrance of hop. Taste is balanced, sweet upfront and mid pallete with a slightly bitter finish. Hops are very light but do help to round out the sweet malt. Love it.

Bottle: Copper coloured, huge, stable off-white head; honey in the nose, sweet malt, too, supported by a good dash of noble aromatic hops; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, soft, gentle MF, light to medium bodied; lingering sweet-bitter finish, noble hops, again, in the aftertaste. A very well balanced pivo..........
Bottled. Sweet malty and chocolate aroma.  Pours with a bronze hue and small off white head.  Quite sweet with grassy and biscuity notes and a strong bitter finish.  Pretty good.

Tis an amber colour with little head. The taste is almost chocolately at times, not at all what I was expecting from it. Not really hoppy at all in my opinion. Definately sweet taste... I see why some people are saying that they see some butterscotch flavour going for it. It is a pretty good beer and I would drink it again if it was made available to me. Bottle purchased in Canada.

Light sweet caramel and some hints of butterscotch in the vaguely fruity aroma.  Clear amber-golden coloured body is topped by a low white head that recedes instantly to ring.  Caramel and butterscotch up front in the flavour are joined by herbal, earthy hops and a surprising bitterness along with some light phenolics before giving way to the caramel sweetness once again.  Medium light body with moderate carbonation is perhaps a touch watery in texture.  Vienna?  Tumbler.  Just above fridge temperature.  Bottle (5.2%, BB24/05/07, BCLS at Commercial, Sep-06).
This is a good beer!  It has a nice appearance to it with its amber look.  Now real aftertaste though, beer goes down smoothly, and tastes great.

Bottle.  Sweet malty aroma, light saazy hops and caramel.  Orange amber with a lacy white head.  Very hoppy, saazy taste.  Medium body, flowery hoppy finish, sweetish.  Caramelly with earthy notes, but above all light and refreshing.    Spicy/peppery wth good light fruitiness, crisp and with a light caress of alcohol.  Balanced and quaffable.  Good cheer embodied.
(Bottle) Surprisingly flavourful lager. Good body with observable alcoholic mouthfeel. Mellow maltedness keeps in good balance. Lasting white cloud atop a plain golden grass.
Nice dark golden body with medium sized frothy white head. Aroma is malty with bread and caramel and a touch of hops.  Moderate sweet flavour melts into a slightly bitter finish.
A pretty good copper coloured beer with a light maltness slightly sweet and good hop bitterness.
copper-gold with thin head, carbonated. Light malty aroma. Raisin sweetness, dry, earthy finish.

Bottle. Dark gold body with quick-fading white bubbly head. Thin malty/hoppy aroma with some sweet notes. Taste is well balanced but it definitely lacks strenght and complexity. Carbonation is agressive and finish is quite short. Not impressed...

Bottle from BC, Merci JM. BB 24/05/06. Hazy red amber lager with a thin off white head. Very nice sweetish caramel aroma with notes of berries and grapes. In mouth, a nice caramel malt with lots of fruity esters, light hops, medium bodied, and oily mouthfeel. Quite nice.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2006 Dark gold, well carbonated and feeding a lasting 1-inch cream. There has to be a good proportion of pils malt in there, it procures a very pleasant crisp balance between the viennas sourdough meets soft nutty caramel, rather sweet display and the pils toasty, hay-like, fresh flavours. Underlying hops are genuinely full of czech character, oily, grassy, not overexpressive, but positioned how and where they need to be and luckily cutting short the sweetness aspirations it shows in the first half. Excellent texture, medium body with the oiliness giving a certain richness impression despite being a moderately light lager. Adequate medium carbonation invites to the next sip. A simplistic approach that shows most efficient. I would have cracked open another one right after drinking this one. Quite fresh 500mL, BB late september.
Clear amber with an average looking head. Good flavour, nutty toffee honey and just enough hoppyness for the style.

500ml bottle at 5.2%  Amber colour with pale beige head.  Slightly toffeeish nose with more toffee malt in mouth.  Finish has some good tingly hop.  OK half dark beer.   Bit too sweet up front, but the rest is ok
I bought this to put in my Waterzooie but it was so good I drank it!  Dark amber, rocky white head, good lacing. Wonderful toffee & fruity notes. Good full mouthfeel.  Id buy it again.

Bottle. Amber brown body, with a small white head. Aroma of tangy caramel malt, light note of fusels. Sweet saccharine wisps. Flavour is dull, sweet generic European character. Tart toasty bite, lingering dry aftertaste. Fruity notes as it warms up with light notes of pilsener-esque European hops bitterness that seems out of place. Average palate. Not bad but not my cup of tea. Thanks JoeMcPhee.
Copper with a decent head.  Smooth, hoppy, flavour with a great malty base.  I even tasted some whisky-ish flavour.  Smooth all around.
Sparkling amber,biege head.Light malt nose. Slightly grainy malt profile, I dont notice much in the way of Saaz hops like others did.

Pours a rich copper colour with no head to speak of. Sweet malty nose. The taste has a  rather interesting progression of flavours. First it starts out sweet then the malt kicks in followed by grassy hops. I found it quite drinkable as made my way through it.

From the bottle: (but just a regular crown cap) Pours clear copper with a slight off white head that fades. Malt dominates the aroma with , toasted marshmallow and toffee as well as bready and molasses tones.
Flavour is lighter than expected. Malty and slightly nutty  through the middle. carbonation rides the back end. Slight sour aftertaste. Very smooth.

500 ml bottle.  Deep copper colour, thin white head.  Nice sweet malty aroma, brown sugar, toffee, with the complexity that only a decoction can give you.  Dark bready malt flavour, fairly sweet, light nuttiness and some caramel and toffee.  Silky smooth and easy to drink.
Clear and coppery, medium head. Im not sure what this beer is marketed as, but it comes across as a tasty moderately hoppy ale. Well balanced and refreshing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottled. Amber coloured. Some hops in the aroma. Sweet fruity flavour with notes of caramel. Some bitterness in the finish.
Golden / Red colour. Quickly disappearing head. Slightly bitter finish. Body is fruity and caramelly. A bit dusty.

The Lure:An amber colour obviously for this polotmavé, with fast diminishing head and scarce lacing. Peppery hops pierce the dry malt husks, but fail to create any vigor and interest.

The Festivities:Peppery caramel dominates the mostly malty average-sized body. A dryish grassy hop finish and light toastiness precede the peachy fruitiness. All is united in softness, nothing is wrong, but this is just boring.

Transcendence:The demons gotten fat and complacent methinks.

Bottled. Pale copper coloured, not much head. Very bready aroma with hints of caramel. The same in flavour, with hints of hops. Very refreshing beer and nice palate. Hard to find now, so I hope I had bought more if this one last year.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2005 Very little head. Copper colour. Smells like old vegetables. One sip is enough. I think demons replaced my beer with vile demonic fluid.

Subsequent sample tended more towards balance and style.
Clear dark golden body with average size frothy white head. Aroma is malty with hints of bread and caramel. Moderate sweet flavor with a light bitterness, slight acidic in the finish.

Aroma: fairly slight aroma but was prominantly malt. Appearance: amber red and clear with a tiny head. Flavour: sweet caramel malt with some hop presence. Palate: medium to light body. My sort of drink.. I wish I could have had it from one of those fancy bottles.

Bottle Large, rocky, off-white head, which is mostly lasting.  Spare lace.  Amber-orange, sparkling body.  Hoppy aroma with some malty hints. Lightly bodied.  Soft carbonation.  Lightly sweet, moderately initial flavour.  Averagily bitter finish.
Red amber colour with good head. Sweet hop aroma. Sweet malt hop flavour. Smooth palate.

20 Aug 04 Aroma: Sweet stone fruit. Appear: Clear brown orange, low head nice suds lacing. Flavour: Sweet malt, lightly hop somplexity slightly spiritous. Palate: Medium mouthfeel, nicely finishing lingering malt. Overall: Could drink this for a while.
golden, sparkly appearance.  aroma is fresh and slightly winey.  not to pleasant.  mouthfeel heavy.  tastes a bit skunky but behind that there is a pleasant flavor

(On tap). My notes say this beer has a hoppy, weird skunky/creamy-lactic aroma. Perhaps this is the caramel everybody is talking about..... For some reason I didnt notice. Clear, light amber coloured with a short, off-white head. Hoppy, moderate bitter, malty and lactic taste. Bit dry beer, but fresh. Not really my thing.

Draught at "Steak Restaurant", Prague. 
Skip the steak, gimme a beer, prosim: Charneol colour. Swaet aroma. Flavour was sweat up front, followed up by toffee. Quite malty(but soft) anda a little ashy. A poor bock.
this brewski had a pretty ugly appearance. thin head and very bubbly. sweet champagne aroma. humbly bitter taste. wasnt really feeling this guy.

very nice transparent amber/copper color with a short living white head.  aroma is of light caremel and herby hops.  nice malty caramelness up front with a refreshing hops bitterness.  very clean tastiing.
deep copper colour, with averagre white head. malty and bitter. caramel flavour not overpowering.
Draught in Prague. Beautiful copper color and medium fluffy head. Aroma of butter, caramel and herbs. Wonderful malty palate and medium strength bitterness. The soul has been sold.
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2006 Quite like the colour but that is a far as it goes I reckon. Tastes like a mid strength, notes of caramel and/or butter, small amount of bitterness right at the very end.

Orangey amber xtal clear with a medium small bubbled off white head and medium ragged lace. Malty bread and caramel, plus a hint of stale canal water and conditioned British ale aroma. Medium light smooth body. Mild bitter start moving to maltier sweeter middle. You keep thinking you are going to get a hoppy zingy lift somewhere but it never comes. Finish is on the weak side with a touch of that brit pub ale feel to it again. Actually that is kinda interesting in itself. Hummm. . . is it better than the Starobrno Cerveny Drak. Probably yes.
Light amber. Medium head. Sweet, hoppy, caramel notes and some spices. Bitterness not so distinct in the end. Is a bit watery.

Orange colour, good bubbly head, quite lasting. Caramel and flour in the aroma. The beer has this strange, but good bread taste and then roasted malts and sweetness (caramel). The finish is too weak, not enought bitter, a bit watery. Refreshing, perfect for a sunny day in spring.

just like a good altbier without the fruitiness. dark gold i guess, with nice icefloe head. very buttery and rich with long and tasty flowery saaz finish. just the thing when you are watching motelpogo taking on a couple of table tennis professionals somewhere in the mountains
Fantastic bronze-copper color, foamy head and flavor of Saaz hops. I am not sure it is Vienna - Lobkowicz brewers call it "mahogany lager".
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2005 Fiery light brown colour.  Toasty, roasty aroma with munich malt accents.  Robust, smoky, nutty, caramelly malt character.  Quite earthy.  Long finish.  Excellent lager.
bronze colour, big head, hoppy and fruity, some bitterness, full-bodied, smooth
